sentences.english: Abundance One of the most common human fears is scarcity.
sentences.chinese: 知足常乐贫穷是人类最普遍的恐惧之一。

sentences.english: Hi is the richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.
sentences.chinese: 知足常乐者最富有，因为知足本身就是财富。

sentences.english: He is richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.
sentences.chinese: 知足常乐者最富有，因为知足本身就是天然的财富。

sentences.english: The happiest people are those who are contented with what they currently have, not with what they lack.
sentences.chinese: 最快乐的那些人总是会知足常乐，而不会伤怀所缺的。

sentences.english: In other words, they count their blessings .
sentences.chinese: 换句话说，他们知足常乐。

sentences.english: Let's just let ourselves be happy and satistied.
sentences.chinese: 就让我们知足常乐，无憾的欣赏。

sentences.english: They simply learnt to be satisfied with their lot .
sentences.chinese: 他们只是懂得知足常乐罢了。

sentences.english: Life will rock if you realize you’re already doing the best thing ever.
sentences.chinese: 如果你懂得知足常乐，那么你的生活将充满惊喜。

sentences.english: But more importantly, they are about achieving contentment.
sentences.chinese: 但更为重要的是要懂得知足常乐。

sentences.english: They needed to learn the lesson of abundance.
sentences.chinese: 其实，他们就需要学会知足常乐这一课。

sentences.english: First optimistic attitude to life, contentment.
sentences.chinese: 首先要乐天知命，知足常乐。

sentences.english: Are you an easily satisfied man?
sentences.chinese: 你是个知足常乐的人吗？

definition: content with one's situation/to know contentment (hence happiness)
at home wherever one is (idiom); ready to adapt/flexible/to accept circumstances with good will
to be content with what one is
not to become attached to material things, not to pity oneself
pinyin: bu4 yi3 wu4 xi3 , bu4 yi3 ji3 bei1

definition: to be content with poverty and strive for virtue (idiom)
to not take to heart/to be free of worried thoughts/to adopt a lighthearted perspective/lighthearted
to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
to enjoy the present (idiom); to live happily with no thought for the future/make merry while you can/carpe diem
living a simple life as one's ideal (idiom)
not caring about fame and fortune (idiom)/indifferent to worldly rewards
to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
